title: Graph Algorithm Visualizer
description: Build a comprehensive graph algorithm visualizer that demonstrates the core concepts from Discrete Mathematics II. The project should provide an interactive interface for creating graphs and visualizing how different graph algorithms execute step-by-step. This project integrates combinatorics (counting paths), graph theory, and graph algorithms into a single cohesive application that helps users understand these mathematical concepts through visual exploration.
requirements: Implement a graph data structure supporting both directed and undirected graphs with weighted edges
Provide an interactive UI for creating, editing, and visualizing graphs (vertices and edges)
Implement and visualize Breadth-First Search (BFS) with step-by-step animation showing the queue state and visited nodes
Implement and visualize Depth-First Search (DFS) with step-by-step animation showing the stack/recursion state
Implement and visualize Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm with priority queue visualization
Implement and visualize a minimum spanning tree algorithm (Kruskal's or Prim's)
Display graph properties such as vertex degrees, total edges, and whether the graph is connected
Implement path counting between two vertices using combinatorial methods
Allow users to select algorithms, set speed of animation, and step through execution manually
Display algorithm complexity and iteration count for educational purposes
Include at least 3 pre-built example graphs demonstrating different graph types
Provide clear documentation explaining the mathematical concepts and algorithms implemented
